p: The SARS and MERS outbreaks, caused by SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively, caused diseases with similar symptoms [ 8]. These viruses caused acute respiratory infections with the sudden emergence of flu-like symptoms and the aggravation of pre-existing medical conditions [ 1]. The SARS outbreak severely affected China and neighboring countries, with a fatality rate of about 9%, while the MERS outbreak affected Asia with symptoms similar to those of SARS. However, the fatality rate was far higher for MERS (about 30%) than SARS.
